alert.note: Alert for Hamilton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 4:57PM CDT until May 21 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Hamilton County in Central Texas * WHEN...Until 800 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen with more rain expected. - Areas along FM 2005 and FM 221 have received excessive rainfall in a short amount of time so may flood. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hamilton and Evant.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
